alert.note: Alert for Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 11:13AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Trap Rock River near Lake Linden affecting Houghton County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Trap Rock River near Lake Linden. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge on Cemetery Road creating backwater effects at and upstream of the gauging station At 10.5 feet, Low lying sections of Cemetery and Angman Roads become inundated. Minor flooding of residential property near the bridge on Angman Road begins...but no homes are known to be impacted at this level * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.7 feet on 04/15/1976. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 800 AM EDT.
